intro: Blepharis sindica, commonly known as the Indian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of India and Pakistan. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or violet flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of xerophytic vegetation.
